intro: Platytheca verticillata, commonly known as the clustered goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a low-growing, herbaceous habit with opposite, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, giving it a striking appearance. Platytheca verticillata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
